articles.content:
Greetings to Prime Minister of St. Kitts-Nevis 
      Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Hong Song Nam, premier of the DPRK cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Denzil Douglas, Prime Minister of St. Kitts-Nevis, on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of the independence of the country.  
  The message extended warm congratulations to the Prime Minister, government and people of St. Kitts-Nevis and wished him and the government success in the work for the progress and prosperity of the country and the well-being of the people.

articles.content:
Kim Jong Il sends wreath to bier of Kang Hyon Su 
     Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il today sent a wreath to the bier of Kang Hyon Su, member of the Worker's Party of Korea Central Committee, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and chief secretary of the Pyongyang city committee of the WPK, expressing deep condolences over his death.

Kye Sun Hui of DPRK places third at 27th Olympiad 
     Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- DPRK Judoist Kye Sun Hui reportedly won the bronze medal in the 52 kg division of women's Judo at the 27th Olympiad in  Sidney, Australia.

Floral baskets laid before portraits in Peru 
      Pyongyang, September 18 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were laid before the portraits of the President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il at the DPRK embassy in lima on Sept. 8 on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of the DPRK by the Foreign Ministry, the speaker of the parliament, the Chairman of the National Defence Commission of the parliament, the Mayor of Callao, the Youth of the "Cambio 90" Movement, the dean of the statistics faculty of San Marcos National University and the Society for the Study of Revolutionary Activities of Comrade Kim Jong Suk of Peru.
